sentence.Network_en: He is rapidly losing the support of blue-collar voters and of middle-class conservatives.

sentence.Network_en: And by 1956 a majority of U.S. workers held white - collar rather than blue - collar jobs.

entry.tran: 蓝领的；从事体力劳动的
entry.def: Blue-collar workers work in industry, doing physical work, rather than in offices.

example.ex: By 1925, blue-collar workers in manufacturing industry had become the largest occupational group.
example.tran: 到1925年，制造业的蓝领工人已成为最大的职业群体。

means.word_mean: 1. of or designating manual industrial work or workers
2. of those who work for wages especially manual or industrial laborers;
